snippet: What had been a local protest has turned into a national drama, spawning vigils and front-page news coverage, while prompting criticism of the government of President François Hollande.
abstract: Protests that began in 2013 in Lisle-sur-Tarn, France, to oppose construction of nearby dam have turned into a national drama and have prompted criticism of Pres Francois Hollande's leadership; outcry resonates with many young people in France, who see few future opportunities and feel little kinship with the government.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: What had been a local protest has turned into a national drama, spawning vigils and front-page news coverage, while prompting criticism of the government of President François Hollande.

headline.main: In France, Dam Is the Catalyst for a Flood of Young People’s Anger
headline.print_headline: In France, Dam Is the Catalyst for a Flood of Young People’s Anger
